storyInfo: Warmy returns to her hometown and enjoys an outdoor movie with the members of the community. The story's ending remains untold, but she wants to put an end to it all.

attributes.content: Aiâ€”yah!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Phew... good, good.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Are you okay, Warmy?
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Hehe, I'm fine! I caught the dish! And look at the bowls! They're all fine!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Sorry, Nanna Radish Leaves. I just got this staff, so I'm not used to it yet, and I sometimes knock things over when I'm not paying attention.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: The girl stands on her tiptoes to put the fallen plates and bowls back to where they belong.
Haha, silly girl.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Remember? Back when you used to come to my place for cystymilk crisps, you needed a little stool to reach your bowl in the cupboard.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Come, let Nanna see. You've grown quite tall...
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Hehe, I think so too!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Let's see. Oh dear, your collar's got a snagged thread.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Oh, you're right... I've been traveling for so long, I haven't even noticed...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Come, get changed. I'll patch this up for you.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: It's okay, Nanna. I can fix this myself.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Look, I have my own little sewing kit!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: *sigh*, you must've had it pretty hard on the road.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Didn't you say in the letter that somebody moved into the room I was in?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: It feels like... not a lot has changed here.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: After you'd left, I did have a few young men move in. Haven't you heard that they found a new area rich in minerals in the next town over?
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Just like you, the kid who stayed here before simply left a letter and took off in a hurry.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: What's the matter? Have you talked to your Uncle Fat Head about staying here today? Hold on just a moment. I'll get your room ready.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: It's okay, Nanna. I'll be leaving again soon.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I'm back here this time because I wanted to see everybody again... including my dad.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: I haven't heard anything about your father lately. Maybe you could try asking around. Somebody might just have heard something.
attributes.name: Button Shop Tailor

attributes.content: Yep, it's okay.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: And there's one other really important thingâ€”
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: They'll play an outdoor movie at the rundown factory plot this evening.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Why don't you come?! I'll pay for everyone's tickets!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Huh? Why are you laughing? I really will!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: We actually made it through all kinds of danger and crossed a sandbeast's paradise that nobody knows about, and found a Feranmut nest there!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: There are lots, lots, lots of really tall Originium crystals there... They're even taller than these tower cranes and furnaces!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Hah, good! I believe you!
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: I'll tell all the workers how you visited that Blinking Valley place far, far away...
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: It's the Grinning Valley!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Ah, right. The Grinning Valley!
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: You've been traveling for so long, Warmy. I'm sure you've picked up plenty of new skills.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: But you know, I think it's good enough as long as you stay safe out there.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Remember to come back and visit more often.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Mm, but I...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Look at this. What did I just tell you?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: I said I'd make this thing as good as new before you finished telling two stories, didn't I?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Now take this folding chair back to your nanna Radish Leaves! Tell her she could tap dance on the chair and it wouldn't break!
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Okay! Thanks, Uncle Mustache!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: And also...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Hm? What else do you need?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: There's gonna be an outdoor movie screening this evening... Let's watch together!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Outdoor movie? Hah, no wonder she wanted to get this folding chair fixed.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Alright, then. I'll go!
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: It's been years since the last time I watched a movie. All they've been playing are those adventure flicks. That's what young people these days like, no?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Old folks like us prefer those slow-paced family films.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Not at all. I love family movies.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Back then... It was Daddy who asked me to watch movies with him.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I still remember how he would tear up whenever the relatives said goodbye to the main characters with smiles on their faces...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: That's even though he was a grown man.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Your old man... right.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: He's a sentimental one. We all know it.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: My kidâ€”you know the one you called Screwheadâ€”he went to the cities to study engineering.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: I couldn't leave for too long, because of my business. It was your old man who took him to school whenever it was time to go back... Remember?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Yep, I remember.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: When I was small, every time he left for work, he'd bring me to your shop.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Even though he told me he was going to the mines, I always asked you where he was...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Haha, that's right.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: You've always got on so well with your old man. *sigh* You really miss him, don't you?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I heard Screwhead's graduated, stayed in the city, and even got a good job.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I'm so glad!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: And I know my daddy would be really happy, too!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Good kid...
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Right... right. Your old man definitely knows. He doesn't talk much, but news always gets to him fast.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: He's probably working in some mine right now, with a lot of weight on his shoulders... I'm sure of it! I just hope their card games there aren't much different from here.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: I know when you two see each other again, he'll be very proud of what a big girl you've become!
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Right, that big mining ship you're off to. Where's it headed?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Hm... I'm not really sure.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Lanns and Savage told me that I'm going to Rhodes Island to get treatmâ€”No, that's not all. It's so I can learn lots and lots of new things!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alright, but promise me this. Take care of yourself, okay?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Yep... I will!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Hey, Ol' Mustache! Here's your loudspeaker.
attributes.name: Construction Team Bricklayer

attributes.content: Alright, got it!
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Loudspeaker?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Haha, you've never seen such a strange looking trinket? It's one of the hottest products developed by Screwhead's company.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Kid tells me it's got such a narrow, crooked neck because that's how it carries sound to far-off places.
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Well, the workers here just use it to chitchat up on the scaffolding... but that ain't so bad, right?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Uncle Mustache.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Repair Shop Machinist

attributes.content: Is it okay if I borrow this?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Hello, everybody... Huh?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (Loudspeaker) Hello, everybody!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Whoa... Why is it so loud...?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: The workers, all dressed in a variety of outfits, look to the source of the sound.
They see a young girl with a loudspeaker poking her head through the rusted shutters.
(Loudspeaker) Hello, everybody! Tonight...!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (Loudspeaker) Tonight, let's watch an outdoor movie together!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (Loudspeaker) At the same place as before, the rundown factory plot!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (Loudspeaker) A-And also...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (Loudspeaker) Remember not too eat too much for dinner. I'll have snacks for everyone!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Huh? There's a movie today? And snacks?
attributes.name: Factory Inventory Keeper

attributes.content: Just the thing I need after spending all night inspecting galvanized steel!
attributes.name: Factory Quality Checker

attributes.content: Hey, lads, don't forget to grab a couple cases of fizzy drinks from the canteen!
attributes.name: Factory Quality Checker

attributes.content: Right, whose kid was that again? She's got a loud voice.
attributes.name: Factory Procurement Worker

attributes.content: I remember her... From the looks of it, she must've found her old man. Good. Good...
attributes.name: Factory Auditor

attributes.content: Oh, so that's her... How long has she been gone? Two years? So it's been two years already...?
attributes.name: Factory Porter

attributes.content: Ah... two years, in the blink of an eye.
attributes.name: Factory Porter

attributes.content: Heh, it's like the blink of an eye to us alright.
attributes.name: Factory Technician

attributes.content: But I'm sure those same two years have been a very long time to her.
attributes.name: Factory Technician

attributes.content: The factory workers keep piling into the empty plot.
(Loudspeaker) Everyone! The movie is about the start!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (Loudspeaker) If you have tall chairs, lean back as much as you can. If you have short ones, come as close to the front as possible to not block the people behind!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: There are rows and rows of seats. Most have already taken settled in, while a few are trying to find a spot more to their liking.
Some run up to the roof, some decide to dangle themselves from a crane, and some opt just to go to behind the silver screen.
(Loudspeaker) Potlidâ€”
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: H-Hu-Huh?! Lanns?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Oh no! I haven't turned the loudspeaker off yet!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Huh? Loudspeaker?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: So everyone here heard my nickname for you loud and clear, then?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: How about it? Everyone thinks it's a great nickname, right?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: *whimper*...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Hello? Can anyone hear me?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'm never speaking to you again!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alright, alright. I'm sorry... I'm just worried about you!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Didn't we agree you'd reach out to me as soon as you finished saying hi to the townspeople?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Oh, right.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I got so busy that I forgot...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: What do I do with you...? Never mind. Are you happy you got to see everyone?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Yep, I'm very happy!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Really, really happy!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Haha, that's good. Very good.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Warmy, the movie is about to start!
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Oh, coming!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Now off you go.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Finish saying all the things you've been holding in for the last couple years. We'll come to the town's station to pick you up tomorrow.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Lanns, I can go tonight.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: But... Would it be alright to have you pick me up there?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: The workers keep their eyes focused on the screen. The protagonist's monologue is echoing in their ears.

attributes.text: 'At the time, I still didn't know where that truck would take him.'
'The wilderness is vast. If you get separated, you may never see each other again.'
'But where is the path ahead that I seek?'
'Having missed the last ride, I follow the dark road and march onward to daybreak.'

attributes.content: Huh...? Is the movie over already?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: But it kind of feels like the story's not over yet... What did the main character mean by that in the end?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I don't think I get it... but everyone must've really enjoyed the movie...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Ah, good movie.
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: I'm jealous... He spent a lifetime chasing a single idea. So courageous.
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: Oh, please. This stuff only ever happens in movies. Nobody would be so unrealistic in real life.
attributes.name: Furniture Factory Woodworker

attributes.content: Take a guess. Why didn't the director give us a clear conclusion to his story?
attributes.name: Furniture Factory Woodworker

attributes.content: Everybody knows it in their hearts. He's walking into the mountains, the valleys, to the ends of the earth... He's just walking to a dead end.
attributes.name: Furniture Factory Woodworker

attributes.content: A dead end?
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: You son of a mother... How could you say that?
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: (Hm... I remember these two always bickering with each other...)
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (I'm getting a bad feeling about this...)
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: They made the ending like this because they wanted us to fill in the rest ourselves. You can't figure even that out?
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: If you see nothing but a dead end ahead of him, then I can only feel sorry for how life's been treating you!
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: Hmph, I saw an irresponsible man and that's all. Maybe you're like him.
attributes.name: Furniture Factory Woodworker

attributes.content: If my kid grows up to be like him, I'll beat him 'till he can't leave town!
attributes.name: Furniture Factory Woodworker

attributes.content: Youâ€”
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: What? Wanna go? Let's do it!
attributes.name: Furniture Factory Woodworker

attributes.content: Wh-Why are they fighting all of a sudden?!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Stop fightingâ€”
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Heh! I knew we'd be treated to a wrestling match after the movie!
attributes.name: Spectating Worker

attributes.content: Yeah, hold him down! Don't let him fight back!
attributes.name: Spectating Worker

attributes.content: Quick, pass out the drinks I brought with me. It's time for the encore!
attributes.name: Spectating Worker

attributes.content: Wait... It wasn't supposed to go like this...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: After the movie, it should've been...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Quit making trouble!
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Hyah!
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Ugh... my arm...
attributes.name: Broadcast Station Clerk

attributes.content: Eek... My back...
attributes.name: Furniture Factory Woodworker

attributes.content: Wow, that's amazing... You stopped the two of them in one go!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: *sigh*... You came back for a visit after so long, and these morons didn't change for even one bit.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: It's all okay... Everyone's always yelled at each other for as long as I can remember... Although today feels especially bad.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Good thing you're still here, Uncle Fat Head. You took care of them so quickly.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Not just me. Your desserts helped, too.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Help me put the tape back in the cabinet by the wall, Warmy.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Okay!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: N-Nothing! I was just looking at how long the case says the movie is.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: So that was actually the full version...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Haha... Sounds like you don't like the movie's ending, either.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: N-Not at all. I really like it.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: The movie doesn't say... but I think the main character has already reached his goal and is ready to start a new journey.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Oh, that's just what I think... Even if everyone ends up fighting over what they think the ending is about... I think everyone's opinions are valid!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Silly girl... Why does it matter what anyone else thinks? What's important is what you think.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: So why did you want to show a movie today, Warmy?
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: I just wanted to get everyone together to have some fun... just like what Daddy used to do...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Every time he left home, he'd watch a movie with everybody.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: He said... That's how you cheer everyone up.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Warmy... You're all grown up now.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: I can tell... You wanted to say a proper goodbye, right?
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: But things got so out of hand, I didn't get a chance...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: But, you know what? You've already said your goodbye.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: When you invited all of us here, you told us what you've been through the last two years.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: We can tell you've been taking care of yourself and made new friends... We all know. Just like the movie's main character, you've started a new journey.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: The most important thing is you're still young. You have all kinds of possibilities open to you. Do what it is that you want to do.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: It doesn't matter if you want to stay here, keep looking for your old man, or something else...
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: All of us will support you.
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Uncle Fat Head...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Silly girl. What's there to thank?
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: The next time you're back, we'll watch another movie together. How does that sound?
attributes.name: Town Projectionist

attributes.content: Here we are, girl.
attributes.name: Mineral Transport Worker

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: You see the transport station up ahead? I hear they stopped running the last route to here not too long ago. Good thing the station hasn't been torn down, and the lights are still up.
attributes.name: Mineral Transport Worker

attributes.content: I've got cargo to deliver, so I can't stay with you. Be careful out there.
attributes.name: Mineral Transport Worker

attributes.content: Thanks for the ride.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Don't mention it.
attributes.name: Mineral Transport Worker

attributes.content: There are lots of rocks on the road here. Be careful and don't trip.
attributes.name: Mineral Transport Worker

attributes.content: I will!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Don't worry. I've walked this path many, many times before.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I won't fall down again.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: The girl stops walking.
Ahead, the abandoned tracks are engulfed by the intense darkness. On the ground, a mining hard hat with a large conspicuous dent and a bent, misshapen valve handwheel lie forgotten.
A mining lamp on the ground flickers repeatedly before suddenly losing its glimmer.
I miss you.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: But... I'm going somewhere far, far away now.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Lanns says we're going even farther away than the transports go, and the Grinning Valley...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: B-But you don't have to worry about me... Everyone'll be waiting for Warmy...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: The young girl crosses into the loosely cordoned off area and walks toward the ruins.
She strokes the ice-cold surface of a rock, as though reminiscing that large, rough hand that she never once thought she would ever take her hand off.
Daddy...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Bye bye.
attributes.name: Warmy
